summary: The Air Force contracted with Boeing to turn commercial aircraft into aerial refueling tankers. The contract is an infrequently-used type intended to protect the government from cost overruns and incentivize the contractor to keep costs down. After a nearly 3-year delay, the Air Force accepted the first plane in January—with critical defects that don't meet contract standards. The Air Force is withholding the remaining 20%...
title: KC-46 Tanker Modernization: Aircraft Delivery Has Begun, but Deficiencies Could Affect Operations and Will Take Time to Correct
